SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AlphaBot
A subclass of Robot that knows how to draw letters and numbers.
Arena
The place where the action happens.
ArenaFrame
The JFrame that the Arena sits in.
ArenaListener
In a future version of this library, you will be able to implement this interface and register as a Listener on an arena, and get callbacks as things happen.
ArenaModel
Represents a back-end 'model' of the area; the locations of all the walls, beepers, and robots are stored here.
ArenaPanel
implementation of a JPanel that holds the Arena.
Attributes
A simple extension of the sax Attributes2Impl that shortens the name and attributes to be added and removed in a HashMap-like manner.
BeeperStack
A stack of beepers displayed within the arena.
Digit
This class is a remnant from the library that was included in some of the LCPS-specific labs.
Direction
Represents the concept of an Item in the Arena (like a Robot) facing a specific direction.
Element
NCXMLElements are what the XMLParser turns the String based XML tree it receives from the ClientConnector into.
Hello
main entry point for the 'hello world' Karel demo.
ImageUtils
As we build out this library, we will need a class that will: - Take an instance of an ImageIcon, by default in the 'NORTH' orientation - Replace a 'default' color with the color provided (so robots can have colors) - rotate the icon to make EAST, SOUTH, and WEST versions - return an HashMap of these images.
Item
Item is an 'abstract' concept in this library, representing anything that can be placed in an Arena.
Location
Represents an x,y coordinate within an arena.
MapDataSource
The abstract concept of a 'source' for map data.
MapParser
This class is responsible for taking the XML DOM tree created by the parser and using reflections to populate a ArenaModel representing the map.
Pacing
An enumeration that represents the different speed settings for an Arena.
Robot
One of the main concepts implemented by this Library.
Wall
Represents one wall segment within the arena.
Wall.Orientation
not used yet, but needed instead of magic ints defined in arena
XMLParser
The XMLParser implements ContentHandler to use the SAXParser contained in Apache's J-Xerces2 implementation.
